intro: Gnaphalium callichrysum, commonly known as the golden everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often aromatic. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun conditions.
